title: Cannot create local mono-item for DefId

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The following scenario used to work fine 1.25.0:

bar.rs:
```
pub fn hello_world()
{
    println!("hello world");
}
```

foo.rs:
```
extern crate bar;

pub fn foo()
{
    bar::hello_world();
}
```

And then compile like so:
`rustc --crate-type rlib --emit metadata bar.rs`
`rustc --crate-type rlib --emit llvm-bc bar.rs`
`rustc --crate-type rlib --emit llvm-bc foo.rs -L .`

This would create two .bc files that could be linked together into a program, but when I try this on 1.26.{0,1,2} the compiler crashes like so:

